verb.description: Drain (someone) of their physical or mental resources; tire out.
examples: her day trip had exhausted her
the country has exhausted its treasury reserves

verb.description: Expel (gas or steam) from or into a particular place.

noun.description: Waste gases or air expelled from an engine, turbine, or other machine in the course of its operation.
examples: buses spewing out black clouds of exhaust

origin: Mid 16th century (in the sense draw off or out): from Latin exhaust- drained out, from the verb exhaurire, from ex- out + haurire draw (water), drain.
